A University of Georgia student is still recovering after she was hit by a tree on campus last week.  UGA officials told Channel 2 Action News that a thunderstorm was moving through campus with winds up to 64 mph last Wendesday.  At that time, UGA student Mia Corte was walking through East Campus at Field Street when an uprooted tree hit her.  Corte was taken to a local hospital, where she is in critical condition. Corte sustained serious injuries to the head and body, according to her mother.  On Sunday, Corte‚Äôs mother shared details of the scary incident with Channel 2 Action News.  Corte was trapped under the tree and brush for 15 to 20 minutes before she was taken to the hospital and was saved thanks to the help of several people.  Corte‚Äôs mother said the family is still trying to piece together everything that occurred during the incident, but they have pieced together some of the details.  A family who was in Athens celebrating their daughter‚Äôs graduation helped along with ‚Äòa Calvary of 10-15 fraternity boys‚Äô who helped lift branches so the EMTs could extract Corte.  Corte‚Äôs mother said the whole family was grateful to all of those who helped and said she has been receiving ‚Äòamazing‚Äô care at Piedmont Athens Regional Hospital.  She will soon be released from that hospital to continue her care in Chattanooga.  ¬©2023 Cox Media Group

On Saturday, at 9:50 a.m. Bracebridge OPP responded to a collision between a motorcycle and a pickup truck on Highway 118 near Ashley Lane in Bracebridge. The motorcycle operator, a 37-year-old person from Bracebridge, was transported to hospital with non-life-threatening injuries. Police have charged the operator of the truck, a 50-year-old Bracebridge resident, under the Provincial Offenses Act.  May is Motorcycle Safety Awareness Month and Bracebridge Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) is asking all road users to be extra vigilant when encountering motorcycles. Motorcycles are smaller and it can be difficult gauge their rate of speed. Please provide extra space for motorcycles while travelling and always err on the side of caution when making turning movements around them.

By Express News Service  WARANGAL: The death of an accident victim kicked up a row between the MGM Hospital superintendent and the members of an SC and ST organisation here on Monday. According to Mattewada police, Superintendent Dr V Chandrasekhar lodged a complaint against the SC and ST organisation leaders Gugulothu Tirupati, Ajmeera Venkat, and Vijay for obstruction of duty while the latter filed a complaint under SC and STs (Atrocities Prevention) Act that the superintendent had abused them by taking the name of their caste.  According to MGM Hospital Superintendent Dr V Chandraskehar, one Kasu Ramulu, 46, met with a road accident at Karunapuram on May 12 night. The victim who the doctors had said was under the influence of alcohol suffered injuries and was admitted to MGM hospital for treatment.  The doctors found that Ramulu had suffered fractures in both of his legs and was unable to move. He was shifted to the orthopaedic ward for treatment.  At 1 pm on May 13, the patient suddenly developed convulsions and became unconscious. He was immediately rushed to the general medicine ward. The duty doctors performed CPR, but they could not revive his heartbeat. The patient was declared dead at 1:40 pm. Later the patient was shifted to the mortuary at 2:30 pm after informing Mattewada police. The hospital authorities also informed the patient‚Äôs son and relatives. They said the cause of the death was probably embolism or subdural hematoma.  A little later, about 30 to 50 people came to the hospital claiming to represent the SC and ST organisation and created trouble. They raised slogans and began using abusive language at the doctors and nurses in the casualty.  Chandrasekhar said that they had immediately called the Mattewada police and handed them over the case sheet, attendance register, and the vials of Diclofenac and Pantoprazole injections as demanded by the protestors. He said that the SC &ST Organization members obstructed the duties of the doctors and tried to attack them in the Hospital. While this so, SC ST Organization Member Gugulothu Tirupati alleged that the Superintendent had abused them ‚Äútaking the name of our caste and trying to threaten us.‚Äù  He alleged that due to the negligence of doctors, Kasu Ramulu died in the hospital. Mattewada Inspector N Venkateshwarlu said he had registered a case under the SC and ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989, against the Superintendent. The police also registered a case under Section 353 IPC (prevention of a discharge of duties) against ST Organization Members Gugulothu Tirupati, Ajmera Venkat and Vijay. GASTON COUNTY, N.C. ‚Äî Five people were hurt when two Sea-Doos crashed on Mountain Island Lake, according to the North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission.  Gaston Co- Lucia Riverbend Fire shared these pictures after two personal watercraft crashed on Mountain Island Lake sending five people to the hospital. The latest on the investigation and the injuries tonight on channel 9 eyewitness news at five. pic.twitter.com/0VNvjnyL8V ‚Äî Dave Faherty (@FahertyWSOC9) May 15, 2023  NC Wildlife said the crash happened Sunday at the Riverbend Boat Landing on Eddie Nichols Drive shortly before 6:30 p.m.  The people on the Sea-Doos did not know each other, investigators said, and they don‚Äôt think drugs or alcohol were involved.  All five patients were taken to the hospital with injuries that varied from minor to severe. Investigators say there were two adults on one Sea-Doo and three juveniles on the other.  The Lucia-Riverbend Fire Department told Channel 9‚Ä≤s Dave Faherty they have already responded to four accidents on the lake over the last four weeks, including one drowning.  ‚ÄúWhen they‚Äôre out there riding, they‚Äôre riding erratically. And I say with due disregard, they‚Äôre just not really paying attention,‚Äù Fire Chief David Toomey said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre just trying to have a good time and I understand that.‚Äù  The wreck comes one week after Willie Gray heard an out of control personal watercraft strike his dock at the home he‚Äôs lived in for more than 30 years.  ‚ÄúAs you can see right now, it‚Äôs very calm, but on the weekends it gets crazy here,‚Äù Gray said. ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs still early in the season.‚Äù  Crews are urging people to make sure they use the kill switch on their personal watercraft and wear a flotation device when on the water. It‚Äôs something Tomas Suska knows all too well. He said five years ago, he was on a jet ski when he was struck and had to go to the hospital afterwards.  ‚ÄúJust got in a T-bone accident and didn‚Äôt have time to react. The guy was broken in two different places, so you just got to be very careful,‚Äù he said.  Faherty asked NC Wildlife about possible charges in the Sea-Doo crash they said the case remains under investigation.  This is a developing story, check back at wsoctv.com for updates.  VIDEO: 3 people, dog rescued from overturned boat in Lake Noman, dispatchers confirm  3 people, dog rescued from overturned boat in Lake Noman, dispatchers confirm      ¬©2023 Cox Media Group

According to the Georgia Department of Natural Resources, two people were ejected from a boat vessel on Sunday just around 10 p.m.  Example video title will go here for this video  BUTTS COUNTY, Ga. ‚Äî A person is dead and a Butts County deputy is being charged following a boating accident at Lake Jackson in Jasper County late Sunday night. According to the Georgia Department of Natural Resources, two people were ejected from a boat vessel. One of them was able to swim to shore while the other person drowned.  The next day at around 2 p.m., game wardens were able to locate the body of 56-year-old Joseph Howard Upchurch, according to DNR officials. His body was turned over to the Jasper County Coroner's Office.  DNR officials said a 38-year-old was arrested and charged with operating a vessel under the influence. Butts County Sheriff Gary Long confirmed the person facing charges was his deputy.  The sheriff's office previously said the deputy was in the ICU with "major injuries." Long said the deputy is in critical condition in the hospital with a ruptured spleen, lacerated liver, broken ribs and suffered a concussion.  Georgia law enforcement agencies and the DNR are leading the investigation. Long confirmed the deputy is on administrative leave pending the outcome of the investigation.  The sheriff's office previously asked the public on Facebook for prayers for both families.

Gigi de Lana faints on stage following car accident  The Rise Artists Studio talent fulfills two of her biggest dreams with the upcoming release of her debut album produced by ABS-CBN Music and the staging of her own digital concert under ABS-CBN Events.  MANILA, Philippines ‚Äî Singer Gigi de Lana fainted on stage during her performance at the "Himala ng Buhangin" event in Ilocos Norte last Sunday.  According to social media personality Kriss Achino, Gigi was singing her second song when she fainted.  Medical personnel were quick to bring Gigi backstage after she fainted.  Before the show, Gigi and her bandmates were involved in a car accident that's why Gigi was wearing an arm brace on stage.  The band sustained minor injuries after their van crashed on Sunday as they were traveling from Aurora to Ilocos Norte for the show.  ‚ÄúGigi De Lana and The Gigi Vibes were involved in a car accident today at 10:20 am while traveling from the ‚ÄòSulong Aurora Event‚Äô to the ‚ÄòHimala Sa Buhangin Event‚Äô in Ilocos Norte. The band members, Jon, Oyus, Mela, Gigi, and four other crew members, sustained minor injuries,‚Äù the statement read on Facebook.  ‚ÄúFortunately, no one else was involved in the accident, and all issues have been resolved. The band and crew have received medical clearance from the Ilocos Training and Regional Medical Center Hospital, and they will continue their journey to tonight‚Äôs show,‚Äù it added.  Gigi and her band weren't able to finish the gig and they announced that the upcoming gig in Nueva Ecija has been cancelled.  ‚ÄúHindi man namin natapos ang tugtugan, naramdaman namin ang inyong mainit na pagtanggap sa aming banda. Mga taga-Ilocos Norte, mahal namin kayong lahat,‚Äù it said.  Gigi also apologized to the people of Nueva Ecija for cancelling their show there.  ‚ÄúExcited sana kami sa kuwentuhan, kulitan, at kantahan mamayang gabi. Sadly, we need to cancel tonight‚Äôs gig. We hope you understand we need to prioritize Gigi, Oyus, Jon, and our team members‚Äô recovery after yesterday‚Äôs unfortunate incident. Babawi po kami and we promise to deliver a show that‚Äôs worth the wait,‚Äù she said.  RELATED: Gigi De Lana stages first major live concert

Late Saturday afternoon firefighters from Arrington Fire Department responded to the scene of a two vehicle crash on Emmaus Church Road and Stagecoach Lane. As firefighters arrived on the scene one of the vehicles involved in a two vehicle crash was engulfed in flames. Both drivers of the vehicles managed to get out unharmed before a fire unit arrived on the scene.  The Volkswagen car was heading south on Emmaus Church Road toward Dudley while the other white car was heading north toward Goldsboro. The two vehicles collided when the driver of the Volkswagen attempted to make a left hand turn onto Stagecoach Lane in front of the oncoming vehicle and was struck in the passenger side of the vehicle. Both vehicles came to rest off the highway. The North  Carolina Highway Patrol is investigating the accident and charges are pending.

MADISON, Wis. (WMTV) - The National Transportation Safety Board is set to investigate the Reedsburg crash that resulted in the death of a 13-year-old.  The NTSB announced on Twitter that they will be conducting a safety investigation with the Sauk County Sheriff‚Äôs Office into the crash, with a report expected in 3 weeks. Evelyn Gurney was boarding a school bus when a pickup truck hit her Friday.  ‚ÄúAlthough school buses are extremely safe, we have investigated school bus crashes in which children were injured and, in some cases, died, and identified areas in which safety improvements are needed,‚Äù the NTSB said on their website.  The NTSB reported 1,009 fatal school transportation related crashes from 2011 to 2020.  The community responded to the death by raising money for Gurney‚Äôs family. As of Sunday, the Goals for Gurney GoFundMe has raised $66,000.  Click here to download the NBC15 News app or our NBC15 First Alert weather app.  Copyright 2023 WMTV. All rights reserved.

Deputy Brett Harris. Riverside County Sheriff's Department  A Riverside County Sheriff's deputy has died after suffering catastrophic injuries in an on-duty traffic accident on Friday.  Deputy Brett Harris who was assigned to the Hemet Sheriff's Station was responding to a call for service when he suffered major injuries as a result of the crash in San Jacinto, including a catastrophic brain injury, authorities said.  "In a final act of Service Above Self, it was Deputy Harris's wish to donate his organs so that others may live. The Harris family is currently working with the hospital to ensure his wishes are honored," the Riverside County Sheriff's Department said in a statement.  Deputy Harris leaves behind his parents, siblings and his wife.  "Please continue to pray for Deputy Harris's wife, mother and father, twin sister, brother, and the men and women of RSO as we navigate this process," the statement said.  Another deputy was injured in the crash, as well as the driver of the other vehicle.  Funeral arrangements have not yet been announced.

One person died, and three children and at least four adults were injured in a four-car crash in the South Deering neighborhood Saturday afternoon, Chicago Police Department officials said.  Around 4:30 p.m., a man of unknown age was driving a sedan northbound on the 12100 block of South Torrence Avenue, and a 30-year-old man was driving an SUV southbound with four other people in his car, according to police.  Advertisement  Two other motorists were going north, police said: a 24-year-old man driving a pickup truck with one other person inside, and a 58-year-old woman driving an SUV without any passengers.  While driving north, the driver of the sedan crossed over into the southbound lane and struck the southbound SUV head-on. The drivers of the pickup truck and the other SUV both attempted to avoid the accident. The truck hit a light pole, and the SUV hit an object, according to police.  Advertisement  EMS Plan 2 for the multiple car accident, update to follow as crews are still working the scene (2). pic.twitter.com/YIRcYIoIcV ‚Äî Chicago Fire Media (@CFDMedia) May 13, 2023  The sedan driver was transported in serious condition to Advocate Christ Medical Center in Oak Lawn, where he was pronounced dead, police said.  The man driving the SUV and an adult passenger were taken to the University of Chicago Hospital in serious condition. A 9-year-old, a 5-year-old and a 2-year-old who were also in the SUV were all taken to Comer Children‚Äôs Hospital in good condition, according to police.  The man driving the pickup and the woman driving the other SUV were both taken to the University of Chicago in critical condition, police said.  According to police, no citations were issued. Police are investigating.  oalexander@chicagotribune.com

Tower Motorsports driver John Farano was hospitalised after an accident in Sunday‚Äôs IMSA WeatherTech Sportscar Championship race at WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca.  At the end of the first hour of the Motul Course de Monterey, Farano was at the wheel of his #8 Oreca LMP2 07 when he ran off course at turn five and hit the tyre barriers. The single-car incident required some time to clear up, while rescue workers took extra care to get Farano out of his car.  The 63-year-old from Toronto, Ontario, Canada was then taken to nearby Natividad Hospital in Salinas for further evaluation.  As of press time Sunday evening (Monday morning in the United Kingdom) Farano is due to be released from hospital imminently.  A statement from Tower Motorsports reads: ‚ÄúWhile competing in the Course de Monterey at Laguna Seca, John Farano was involved in an accident, resulting in him going to the hospital as a precautionary measure. John is in good spirits and will be released shortly before heading home with his family.‚Äù  ‚ÄúTower Motorsports and John Farano would like to extend our sincere gratitude to the AMR medical team at the track and the staff at the Natividad hospital for their incredible work and attentive care. We would also like to thank IMSA for their swift and prompt support following the accident.‚Äù  Farano, the reigning IMSA LMP2 Drivers‚Äô Champion, entered Sunday‚Äôs race at Laguna Seca as the LMP2 points leader after winning the Sebring 12 Hours with Scott McLaughlin and Kyffin Simpson. Louis Deletraz, Farano‚Äôs co-driver for most of 2022, rejoined the team this weekend.  Next month Farano is due to take part in his second 24 Hours of Le Mans in an LMP2 Pro-Am entry alongside championship-winning co-drivers Ricky Taylor and Ren√© Rast.  Feature image courtesy of IMSA

Deputies were called to the 100 block of Hurd Shoals Road around 4:50 a.m. to investigate the accident.  The male driver of the vehicle was pronounced dead at the scene. ANI  Baloda Bazaar, May 15  Six people, including a child, were killed in a road accident in Chhattisgarh‚Äôs Baloda Bazaar district on Monday, police said.  According to the police, the accident took place near Goda Bridge in the Baloda Bazaar district after a pickup vehicle carrying over two dozen people was hit by a truck leaving six dead.  The incident took place under Palari police station limits. A child and a woman are among those killed, Baloda Bazaar SSP Deepak Jha said.  Further details are awaited.

SHELTON ‚Äî A Stratford man died Sunday after a crash on Route 8, authorities said Sunday.  State Police said Daniel Gillespy, 22, died while driving south of Exit 12 at 5:30 a.m. They said his vehicle travelled across the left lane and entered into the median, where it crashed into a tree.  "(Gillespy) sustained fatal injuries and was pronounced deceased on scene," they said.  Earlier Sunday, police said the crash led to the highway being closed until the afternoon. Local firefighters and state police were responded to the crash around 7 a.m.  Police said the accident remains under investigation, and are seeking witnesses to the crash.

A Shannon County accident late Saturday afternoon injured a Mountain View driver, the Missouri State Highway Patrol said.  Gage W. Myers, 31, of Mountain View, was driving a westbound 2015 Chevrolet Silverado that ran off U.S. 60 into the median, struck a dirt embankment, went airborne and came to rest on its wheels, the patrol said. Myers, who was wearing a seat belt, was taken with moderate injuries by ambulance to Mercy Hospital in Mountain View. He was wearing a seat belt. The vehicle was totaled in the wreck east of his hometown.

The Kerala Story's Adah Sharma Meets With Road Accident, Shares Health Update (Image Credit: Instagram)  KEY HIGHLIGHTS Adah Sharma meets with a road accident on Sunday  The actress shares health update  She was recently seen in The Kerala Story  Adah Sharma and the team meet with an accident  Last night (May 14), the actress took to Twitter and shared her health update. Adah told her fans 'not to worry' and tweeted, "I'm fine guys. Getting a lot of messages because of the news circulating about our accident. The whole team, all of us are fine, it's nothing serious, nothing major but thank you for the concern."  For the unversed, the team of The Kerala Story was supposed to join Hindu Ekta Yatra in Karimnagar. But after they met with the road accident, the event was cancelled.  Reportedly, Adah Sharma has also been getting death threats due to the ongoing controversy regarding her latest film The Kerala Story. Sudipto Sen's directorial venture has been facing backlash from a section of political parties and groups who have claimed that the film is not based on facts, and propagates hatred against the Muslim community. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had also declared a ban on The Kerala Story in the state.  About The Kerala Story  Helmed and written by Sudipto Sen, The Kerala Story is about a group of non-Muslim women forced to convert to Islam and join the terrorist organisation ISIS. Apart from Adah, the film also stars Yogita Bihani, Siddhi Idnani and Sonia Balani. It was released in the theatres on May 5 amid controversies.  The movie found itself in the eye of the storm after its teaser claimed that 32,000 women from Kerala had gone missing and joined the international terrorist group. The makers received severe backlash for allegedly malicious propaganda against the state and the Muslim community.

Several members of the Frederick Gunn School‚Äôs junior varsity girls lacrosse team were hurt in a chain reaction crash Saturday involving two of the school‚Äôs minibuses and a pair of SUVs.  Police said all of the injuries appeared minor.  The crash happened around 1:30 p.m. as two Chevrolet minibuses from the private boarding school in Washington were carrying team members northbound on Route 63 just before the Route 4 roundabout in Goshen, according to state troopers from the Canaan barracks.  Pena Florentino was driving southbound in a Nissan Rogue and crossed into the oncoming lane, crashing head-on into one of the two minibuses, police said. The other minibus veered to avoid the Rogue, but rolled onto its side and hit a Chevrolet Suburban owned by the Hotchkiss School in Salisbury, Trooper Rob Flanigan reported.  All four drivers as well as Florentino‚Äôs passenger appeared unhurt, police said. But all passengers from the two minibuses and the Suburban were taken to Hungerford Hospital for evaluation and then released, according to police.  Police are still investigating, but issued Florentino a summons for failing to stay in the proper lane.

‚ÄúThe Cohasset Police and Fire Departments responded to an early morning motorcycle crash involving two people, near the intersection of Border Street and Otis Avenue at approximately 2:30 a.m. Saturday morning, May 13, 2023.  Preliminary investigation revealed that two people, a male and a female were on the motorcycle when it struck a nearby pole. The operator of the motorcycle, a 23-year-old male, suffered life threatening injuries. The passenger, a 26-year-old female, suffered serious but non-life-threatening injuries.  The two individuals were taken by ambulances to South Shore Hospital by the Cohasset and Scituate Fire Departments. Police determined the operator of the motorcycle was not wearing a helmet. Cohasset Police were assisted at the scene by Scituate Police and the Massachusetts State Police Collision Analysis and Reconstruction Section.‚Äù-Cohasset Police Department.

The family of a woman - who was hit by a police motorbike which was part of Sophie, the Duchess of Edinburgh's motorcade - has said they are "praying for a miracle".  Helen Holland is fighting for her life after the crash in west London on Wednesday.  The motorbike collided with the 81-year-old woman at the junction of Cromwell Road and Warwick Road in west London, leaving her in a critical condition, according to the Metropolitan Police.  In a statement released to Sky News, Ms Holland's family described her as a "beautiful, loving, kind and caring lady who would always put anyone before herself".  They said: "The family are deeply saddened and shocked at the news Helen was involved in such a tragic accident."  The family added: "Helen may be 81-years-old but she is sprightly for her age and nothing stopped her living life to the full, spending precious time with her family, muddy walks with the dogs and lunches with friends is what she enjoyed most."

A man has died and two others have been pulled from the water after floating for four hours following a boat accident off the Western Australia coast.  They were found about two nautical miles off the Batavia Coast Marina in Geraldton, about 370 kilometres north of Perth, about 2pm on Sunday.  It is understood the trio had been on a boat that was hit by a wave and sunk.  A boatie found the pair and alerted the local Marine Rescue. (Geraldton Marine Rescue)  One man aged in his 60s died, while two others were left floating in the water for four hours before a boatie found the pair and alerted the local Marine Rescue.  Department of Fire and Emergency Services crews took both survivors back to Geraldton, where one of them, also in his 60s, was taken to the local health campus with hypothermia.  It's understood the man who died is a Geraldton local.

KALAMAZOO MI (WKZO AM/FM) ‚Äì The Kalamazoo County Sheriff‚Äôs Department is continuing its investigation into a two-car accident Saturday evening that sent three people to area hospitals.  Deputies responded to a report of an accident on southbound U.S. 131 just north of the Stadium Drive exit, at around 8:10 p.m.  Three victims were found at the scene; two were taken to Ascension Borgess in Kalamazoo with non-life-threatening injuries.  A third was transported to Bronson Hospital in Kalamazoo, and is reported in critical condition.  Traffic on U.S. 131 was shut down to clear the accident scene.  Deputies were assisted at the scene by Michigan State Police and the Western Michigan University Police Department.

KANSAS CITY, Mo. ‚Äî A multi-vehicle crash Sunday afternoon in Shawnee left one dead and one with critical injuries.  Shawnee police responded around 4:30 p.m. to the intersection of Blackfish Parkway and Lackman Road.  Initially called to investigate an injury accident, police arrived to find a multi-vehicle wreck.  In providing aid to the involved occupants, authorities noted the driver of one of the vehicles sustained fatal injuries. A passenger from the same vehicle was transported to an area hospital in critical condition.  Police report the other drivers were uninjured.  As of 7:30 p.m. Sunday, the intersection remained closed.  Investigation into the incident is ongoing by the Shawnee Police Department Traffic Safety Unit.  ‚Äî

A serious accident involving two motorcyclists occurred on the A50 near Heteren at about 3:20 p.m. on Saturday. In the accident, one of the motorcyclists died. The other did not suffer any injuries, a police spokesperson reported. The police could not say however, whether other vehicles were involved in the accident.  As a result, the road between the Grijsoord and Valburg interchanges was closed, an ANWB spokesperson said on Saturday that the closure is expected to last until 9 p.m.  The police have launched an investigation into the accident and expected it could take hours. Until then, the road remained closed.

Post by Noor Mohi-ud-din on Monday, May 15, 2023  Baramulla, May 14: In a tragic incident, a 2-year-old boy was hit by a vehicle driven by his uncle, resulting in his death in Janzbazpora area of north Kashmir's Baramulla on Sunday.  According to officials, the accident took place on Sunday afternoon when the minor was struck by a vehicle bearing registration number JK05AJ-6410.  The minor victim was identified as Mohammad Moods, son of Mohammad Rafiq Lone, a resident of Janbazpora.  Authorities have registered a case in connection with the incident, and investigations are underway.  The police officer in charge of the case confirmed that the driver of the vehicle was a close relative of the victim.  The incident has left the whole area in mourning.

COLE COUNTY, Mo. (KMIZ)  A Cole County ATV crash left four kids in a Columbia hospital Sunday morning. Another man was seriously injured in Cooper County after an ATV crash Saturday. Two other reports of ATV crashes were recorded in the past week from Moniteau County and Randolph County.  An increase in off-road riders starts anytime temperatures rise, Cpl. Kyle Green with the Missouri State Highway Patrol said. But the chance of getting into an accident also grows.  ‚ÄúThey're not toys at all,‚Äù Green added. ‚ÄúBut that's the way many people view them.‚Äù  Last year alone, the Missouri State Highway Patrol recorded 284 total ATV crashes in the state. Over 70% of those resulted in injuries and 23 of those crashes were fatal. In many cases, Green said safety devices in the vehicle weren‚Äôt being used if they had them.  ‚ÄúThat's unfortunately where we get many of these serious crashes,‚Äù Green said. ‚ÄúWhere people aren't wearing helmets or they're not wearing the seatbelts and they get thrown out into the woods.‚Äù  At the same time, all-terrain vehicle crashes present a different problem for first responders. Cole County EMS said Sunday‚Äôs crash was in a remote location.  ‚ÄúATVs present a little bit more of an operational issue for us,‚Äù Eric Hoy the Chief of Emergency Medical Services said. ‚ÄúWe think there was a delay in activating 911 because they were in such a rural area that they had to get somewhere where they could actually call.‚Äù  Additionally, ambulances were not able to reach the scene alone. The EMS Incident Commander requested mutual aid for all-terrain transport vehicles from the Cole County Emergency Response Team, the Jefferson City Fire Department and Osage Ambulance District.  ‚ÄúIt really limits the capabilities of the first responders,‚Äù Green said. ‚ÄúIf you're going to be out on property that's in a hard-to-reach spot, hard to locate, then you need to let somebody know‚Ä¶ in case something happens, at least we have an idea where to start searching.‚Äù  Driving an all-terrain vehicle impaired is just that too- impaired driving. In 2022, the Missouri State Highway Patrol recorded 50 ATV accidents caused by drinking or drugs.  ‚ÄúOperating these while impaired is dangerous for not only them but for the other people that are out on the roadways,‚Äù Green added.  In Missouri, there‚Äôs no set age to drive an all-terrain vehicle. While children under 18 must legally wear a helmet, they can drive freely on private property. In the same way, the Missouri State Highway Patrol warns it‚Äôs the parent‚Äôs responsibility to make sure the kid is ready ‚Äúmentally and physically‚Äù to drive an ATV.  Wearing a helmet and seatbelt, if the vehicle has one, can decrease the chances of being injured in an ATV or UTV crash Green said. Letting someone know where you‚Äôre headed and having a way to contact 911 if needed can help emergency services get to you more quickly if needed.  Driving an ATV with the same mentality as driving a vehicle could help avoid an accident completely.  ‚ÄúJust be sure to take extra caution just like you would in your vehicle,‚Äù Hoy added.  Drivers can find more on ATV or UTV rules and regulations for Missouri here.
